page.title: 20LEE MOOR AREA-THE FUTURE?.
page.content: It seems likely that the extraction of china clay in the area will continue for many years to come.It has been estimated that there may be enough china clay in the area to keep the industry going for another hundred years.It will mainly depend on the demand for china clay.At the moment the demand is increasing.It is intended by both companies (English China Clays and Watts,Blake,Bearn) to landscape the area ,which will result in two lakes being formed,called Lee Moor Lake and Hemerdon Lake.As well as this it is envisaged that there will be three terraced tips ,grassed on their upper slopes and planted with trees on the lower slopes.It is thought that these lakes could be used as reservoirs and the whole area considered as a'country park'.When this might be is difficult to know.
